page.title: 09CIDER MAKING IN DUNSFORD.
page.content: Before mechanisation farms which are now run by one man had many permanent workers and extra casual labour at harvest.Most farms produced cider for family and workers.One local farmer still produces cider but for sale. {CIDER MAKING.}Collect large quanties of ripe apples,bitter,sour and sweet. A mixture of these is washed,chopped and then taken to the press.A layer of straw is spread over the base of the press.A thick layer of chopped apple is spread over this and overhanging straw is turned up.Then more straw and more apple is added until about a yard high.Apple juice wil run into a large open vat.Gradually the press will be tightened until all the juice is out. The juice is poured into huge barrels and left to ferment.Different mixtures produce dry,medium or sweet ciders.
